co2-calculation:
Assumption: 50% margarine, 50% white flour
CO2-values from EDB.

0.5 * 1.32 + 0.5 * 0.51 = 0.915  kg CO2e/kg puff pastry dough
author: JE
references:
1. General information puff pastry at wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Puff_pastry
2. Different pastries types: http://www.bakingmatters.co.uk/puff-pastry.php
calculation-process-documentation:
Production and storage not included. 

In raw form, puff pastry is a dough composed of two elements.  A "dough packet," or détrempe; and a "butter packet" or other solid fat beurrage. Common types of fat used include butter, vegetable shortenings, and lard.

The production of puff pastry dough can be time-consuming, because it must be kept at a temperature of approximately 16 °C (60 °F) to keep shortening from becoming runny, and must rest in between folds to allow gluten strands time to link up and thus retain layering (1).
name: Blätterteig
comments: Production of stuff pastry not included, only raw ingredients. Need to find out which ratio between flour and fat is commonly used 1:1, 2:1 or 1:3/4?
